title: (x) Similar to Century Gothic - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Yves}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150132im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/81163H_5204.jpg)

Sorry for the horrible image quality, but it’s all I have. I thought it was Century Gothic, but the “M” and “u” don’t look right. I need to know the font and when it was first introduced. This is my first attempt at this, so if I did something wrong, just let me know how to correct it. Thanks.

 [‹ Gourmet Magazine nameplate connected script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150132/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36747 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Technical sans for Cartagena power plant - Alstom Sans {Adriano (self)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150132/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36753 "Go to next forum topic")
author: qdexaminer

comments.content:
<cite>horrible image quality</cite>  
You’re putting lipstick on the pig … :)  
The ‘1’ has no bar to the left … that rules out an unmodified Century Gothic and Avant Garde Gothic.
I’d rather think this is ITC Avant Garde Gothic. According to FontBook it was released in 1970.
